comments.comment_text: Oysters is not something you go to Puglia for; they have some of the best sea food in Italy (lots of dishes with clams); they also eat a lot of meat (bombette di capocollo, braciole), the vegetables are some of the tastiest (great olive oil, tomatoes to top the typical frisella “bread”) of course you have to try the typical pasta dish “orecchiette con le cime di rapa” they also have some good wines, especially if you like rosé. Monopoli and Polignano a Mare are pretty fishermen towns. I personally like Martina Franca as well. Trani is beautiful with it’s cathedral overlooking the sea, Otranto too is cute. If you happen to check out Bari, you can get fish crudités served by fishermen and the traditional “riso patate e cozze”, a dish with rice, clams and potato cooked in a cocotte.
